Question_Text: How many hours did you sleep last night (estimate)?
Wake time consistency: did you wake within ±60 minutes of your usual time? (yes/no)
What is your first stress signal today (jaw, chest, gut, shoulders)?
Caffeine: how many servings today and at what times?
Sensory irritants: which one drains you fastest (noise, light, clutter, temperature)?
Do you take breaks away from screens every hour? (yes/no)
Hydration check: did you drink water in the last 2 hours? (yes/no)
After 60+ minutes of screens, what body area complains first?
Meal timing: when did you last eat, and did it improve or worsen focus?
What is your current energy level 1–10?
What emotion most often precedes your phone-check impulse (boredom, anxiety, loneliness, fatigue)?
What fear do you disguise as ‘being informed’ right now?
How many times did you context-switch in the last hour (estimate)?
What do you call ‘productivity’ that is actually avoidance today?
List your top 3 notification sources hijacking attention (app + purpose).
What is your default story about focus: ‘I’m bad at it’ or ‘my environment is hostile’?
How many tabs are open right now? What would happen if you closed 80%?
What single boundary would reduce distractions by 50%? State the rule.
Where do you demand certainty before you start (perfect plan, perfect mood, perfect tools)?
What is the smallest unit of deep work you can do for 15 minutes today?
What does waiting do to you (panic, irritation, numbness, calm)?
Do you consume content while working? If yes, what happens to quality?
What’s the 5% truer reason you avoid starting?
Pick one ‘temptation app’ and set a rule (delete/block/timebox). Which one?
If you weren’t allowed to optimize tools for a week, what would you actually build?
Schedule a 90-minute no-notifications block. When is it?
Set a screen-off time tonight. What replaces screens for 20 minutes?
Name your current bottleneck: Hardware, OS, or Output. (Pick one.)
What is one thing you will stop doing this week to protect focus?
Name one offline activity that restores you reliably.
